snippet: The detention of Nicolas Sarkozy is a new low for an office created by Charles de Gaulle as the acme of political power and the embodiment of French glory.
abstract: Memo from France; majesty of French presidency hits new low as former Pres Nicolas Sarkozy, whose phone had been tapped by investigators, is taken into police custody; Sarkozy's detention in corruption and influence-peddling case only lasts 15 hours, but ensuing media spectacle underscores French citizens' angst over state of their republic, where the present never seems to live up to the real or imagined glories of the past.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The detention of Nicolas Sarkozy is a new low for an office created by Charles de Gaulle as the acme of political power and the embodiment of French glory.

headline.main: With Detention of Sarkozy, France Laments Presidency’s Faded Grandeur
headline.print_headline: In Sarkozy Episode, a Lament for a Presidency’s Faded Grandeur
